name: Quick and Easy Chicken and Ham Corn Chowder
author: drmomof2boys
summary: This is a soup I make with ingredients we always have. The kids love this with skillet cornbread or biscuits! Would be great in bread bowls, too! Serve hot.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon onion powder, or more to taste
1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, undrained
directions: Heat bacon drippings in 6-quart Dutch oven or stockpot over medium heat
Cook and stir ham in hot bacon drippings until slightly browned, about 5 minutes
Add chicken and potatoes to the pot; cook and stir until the potatoes soften slightly, about 5 minutes
Season the ham mixture with thyme, marjoram, onion powder, and garlic powder
Pour cans of whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, and chicken broth into the pot
Bring the liquid to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer until the potatoes are completely tender, about 10 minutes
